basics.tagline: AI & Backend Developer | Python, FastAPI, LLMs
basics.summary: Backend Developer transitioned into AI/ML. After several years developing with Java and Spring, I've moved towards applying an engineering-first approach (APIs, data, architecture, and production) to AI solutions using Python and FastAPI. I specialize in building services that transform business needs into maintainable features, incorporating RAG pipelines, semantic search, and agentic architectures. I focus on making the 'how it works' as solid as the 'what it does' through automation and robust engineering practices.

experience.summary: Backend engineer applying AI to real products and internal tooling, combining backend, data, and automation.
highlights: Developed APIs and services in Python/FastAPI for data processing and system integration.
Built ingestion and processing pipelines (documents, video) including transcription and validations.
Implemented AI capabilities with LLMs: RAG, embeddings, and vector search integrated into production middleware.
Evolution of AI assistants: managing memory/sessions, stability improvements, and post-deployment fine-tuning.
Automated RAG ingestion via n8n + Python (Sheets -> MongoDB + Pinecone) with hash dedupe; saved ~8-10 hours per setup.
Improved document validation pass rate from 70% to 90% using a GPT+Claude+Gemini ensemble and OCR tuning.
Migrated chat to an agentic architecture (Google ADK) with LiteLLM; ~15% lower latency and ~35% lower infra cost.
Stack: Python, FastAPI, n8n, GCP, MongoDB, BigQuery/Firestore, Pinecone, Docker, GitLab CI/CD, OpenTelemetry.

experience.summary: Focused on backend specialization (Java/Spring) while owning cloud/data integrations and frontend support.
highlights: Strategic Middleware APIs: Designed and developed Spring-based middleware to optimize frontend/external services communication.
GKE Migration & Optimization: Led the migration to Google Kubernetes Engine, automating continuous delivery and optimizing deployments.
Post-Merger Data Integration: Actively participated in the data integration after the Preving/Cualtis merger, performing mapping and application adaptation.
International Experience (Dublin, 2022): Spent 3 months working remotely from Ireland, improving English fluency and adaptability in global environments.
Stack: Java, Spring Framework, Angular, Docker, Kubernetes, GCP, GitLab CI/CD.

experience.summary: Intensive training and first contact with professional web development environments.
highlights: Received intensive training in Java Spring, Angular, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Participated in agile development teams, contributing to real-world projects and learning full software lifecycles.
